text.text: Masjid Bencoolen is a peaceful and convenient place for prayers, just a 3-minute walk from my office. Clean, well-maintained, and welcoming. Highly recommend for anyone nearby!

originalText.text: Masjid Bencoolen is a peaceful and convenient place for prayers, just a 3-minute walk from my office. Clean, well-maintained, and welcoming. Highly recommend for anyone nearby!

text.text: A unique location along one of the busiest street. Difficult but not impossible to get a good carpark. All the hard work will be replace with the momentcyou go in the cool and comfort of this mosque.

originalText.text: A unique location along one of the busiest street. Difficult but not impossible to get a good carpark. All the hard work will be replace with the momentcyou go in the cool and comfort of this mosque.

text.text: Mosque is small but was recently renovated, so its modern looking and slightly larger than how it was. . Catered mostly for the Indian community so the sermons are usually in Tamil. Ladies prayer hall located on the second floor. There's lift to access the different floors.

originalText.text: Mosque is small but was recently renovated, so its modern looking and slightly larger than how it was. . Catered mostly for the Indian community so the sermons are usually in Tamil. Ladies prayer hall located on the second floor. There's lift to access the different floors.

text.text: This masjid has around 3 levels. It is near to hotels around bencoolen. A good location of masjid. It isn't hard to find the masjid since it is located in the main street of bencoolen. The men are praying at the ground level, and women pray on another level. Ablution is located near the masjid entrance door.

text.text: Ladies section facilitators in masjid are absolutely rude. Went for iftar + taraweeh  prayers. So many unnecessary rules and they kept finding reasons to pin point people and scold them. After iftar , the facilitators are not clearing up the place properly, grains of rice are around the prayer area. Prayer mats are apparently for covering up boxes of things and worshippers are not allowed to take them for their spots. What rubbish? Can tell nicely as it’s ramadan period why need to shout and point people during this holy month. During bayaan time they are asking the crowd to keep quiet but another volunteer at the same time is screaming for donations and sales of quranic books. The facilitators need to revise their mannerism and how to conduct crowds in a proper way. Out of all the masjids I’ve went to I’ve seen larger crowds than this but handled properly.
